results.title: Hitler: a film from Germany = Hitler, Ein Film Aus Deutschland
results.creator_credit: Hans Syberberg, BBC, EDR, I N A, Solaris Film and TMS Film GmbH
results.brief_description: In confronting Nazism Syberberg was not interested in the conventions of realism. In Syberberg’s view, ‘one doesn’t fight Hitler with the statistics of Auschwitz and the sociology of his economic system, but with Richard Wagner and Mozart’. In a series of surrealist tableaux in a variety of dramatic modes - fairytale, circus, morality play, allegorical pageant, magic ceremony, philosophical dialogue - in four parts, Syberberg seeks to embrace, in the words of John Sandford, ‘the mythic totality of Hitler’s world (‘pathos’) and the confrontation of the mythic with reality (‘irony’), the sublime with the ridiculous’. For Susan Sontag ‘it is a ghostly film haunted by (Syberberg’s) great cinematic models (Melies, Eisenstein) and antimodels (Riefenstahl, Hollywood), by German Romanticism (and) above all by Wagner and his music’. Contents: Der gral The grail (96 min.)—A German dream Ein Deutscher Traun (126 min.)—The end of a winter’s tale and the final victory of progress Das ende eines wintermarchens (93 min.)—We children of hell remember the European age Wir kinder der holle (100 min.) Also includes the book ‘Syberberg, A filmmaker from Germany’. In German and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Go fish
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Guinevere Turner, Can I Watch Pictures, Islet and KVPI
results.brief_description: Shot in black and white, on a low budget and using a predominantly non-professional cast, Rose Troche’s first feature offers an inside view of lesbian life in the ‘90’s. Max is looking for love, Ely suffers from a long distance relationship and their scheming friends are determined to match them. Navigated by a wistful narration, the film tracks the inter-linked cast of characters from cafes and bookshops to dinner parties, dates and sex. Starring Guinevere Turner, V. S. Brodie, T. Wendy McMillan, Migdalia Melendez and Anastasia Sharp. Screenplay by Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner.

constellations_other.name: Charting queer connections
constellations_other.description: The infamous ‘Incest Map’ in Heartbreak High charts connections between Hartley High students, instigating the drama that unfolds in the series. Explore this fictional map’s connections to lesbian media that has been integral to building lesbian community and culture.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: Gregory Ratoff, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.

results.title: Mousehunt
results.creator_credit: Gore Verbinski, Alan Richie, Bruce Cohen, Tony Ludwig and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: When their elderly father dies, two brothers inherit the family business - the Smuntz string factory - along with a dilapidated house. Ernie Smuntz (Nathan Lane) was a once revered chef but is no more thanks to an unfortunate incident involving the mayor and a cockroach; brother Lars (Lee Evans) is a devoted string factory worker. On viewing the house they discover that it was designed by a revered architect at the turn of the century and is potentially worth millions. The only obstacle to the impending fortune is one wily long time resident, a mouse that’s proving impossible to catch. Christopher Walken has a brief role as a pest exterminator. The film is rated PG due to potentially horrible traps laid by each opponent, including a freakish cat. Cast also includes Vicki Lewis, Eric Christmas and Maury Chaykin.

results.title: Life is beautiful
results.creator_credit: Roberto Benigni, Elda Ferri, Gianluigi Braschi and Melampo Cinematografica
results.brief_description: In this World War II tragicomedy, writer/director Roberto Benigni portrays Guido, who moves during the 30s from the country to a Tuscan town, where he falls in love with schoolteacher Dora. Dora likes Guido, but she remains faithful to her pompous fiancee, causing Guido to come up with inventive ways of wooing her. Meanwhile, anti-semitic attitudes lead to attacks against Jewish members of the community, including Guido’s uncle. Leaping ahead five years, during World War II, Guido and Dora are married with a son Giosue. After they are imprisoned in a concentration camp, Guido goes to elaborate lengths to keep his son from understanding the truth of their situation. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giustino Durano and Giorgio Cantarini.

results.title: The Longest day
results.creator_credit: Andrew Marton, Bernhard Wicki, Gerd Oswald, Ken Annakin, Darryl F. Zanuck, Darryl F Zanuck Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Cornelius Ryan’s compilation of interviews with D Day survivors, the film is broken into three sections- the Allied preparations for invasion, a faithful recreation of the movement of an Armada across the English Channel, and culminating in the attack on Normandy beaches. Intercut with these sequences is the response by German soldiers which are subtitled and directed by Bernhard Wicki. One of the most ambitious war films ever made, ‘The Longest day’ features 48 international stars, 4 directors, and won 2 Academy Awards for Special Effects and Cinematography, and was nominated for Best Picture.

results.title: Jean de Florette
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Lavish film version of Marcel Pagnol’s tale of a simple man who leaves the city to live on an inherited piece of land but is ruined when he fails to find water to irrigate his property because the location of an underground spring is kept secret from him by two scheming villagers who wish to take over the farm. The conclusion to this story comes in the sequel, “Manon des Sources”. “Jean de Florette” stars Yves Montand and Gerard Depardieu.

results.title: New Jack City
results.creator_credit: Mario Van Peebles, Doug McHenry, George Jackson and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This gangster movie for the 90’s has a hard hitting anti drug message, and an enigmatic villain in Nino Brown (Wesley Snipes), a seemingly untouchable drug baron. Brown is a self made man, an entrepreneurial success - the only problem is, he’s made his money from crack. He also has a curious sense of communal loyalty, sharing his wealth with the community around him (and who love him for this generosity), despite supplying a substance that kills. Hot on his tail are the angels, 2 unconventional police officers Scotty and Nick (Ice-T, Judd Nelson) who will stop at nothing to rid the New York City streets of Nino Brown’s power. Brown has converted an abandoned Harlem apartment building into an impenetrable fortress which houses his gang, the Cash Money Brothers. This building must be infiltrated and the only way to do it is to send someone in undercover. Initially they send an ex drug addict (Chris Rock), but when he is unsuccessful, it’s left to Scotty to play the part of a drug dealer and make his way to Nino Brown himself. Cast also includes Vanessa Williams.

results.title: The Shoes of the fisherman
results.creator_credit: Michael Anderson, George Englund and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Anthony Quinn and Sir Laurence Olivier head a distinguished international cast in this passionate drama about a Russian bishop, who, after twenty years as a political prisoner, is elected Pope. This stirring adaptation of Morris West’s bestseller about the election of the first Russian Pope and its effect on world peace presents a powerful image of a world on the brink of self-destruction. Also stars Sir John Gielgud, Vittorio de Sica, Oskar Werner and Leo McKern as members of the Vatican’s inner circle.

results.title: The Magnificent rebel
results.creator_credit: Georg Tressler and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A journey into Ludwig van Beethoven’s incredible life of music starring Carl Boehm, an Austrian actor-classical pianist, as Beethoven. The story begins in 1792 in Vienna where Beethoven, aged 22, is studying music and composition under one of the music masters of the time, Joseph Haydn. It is Beethoven’s early period when his enthusiasm is ahead of his ability, particularly in the high classical style, but it is also a time for him to establish himself as a pianist and a composer and earn an income. Beethoven struggled for many years to be accepted by the music discerning public and it was not until he composed his dramatic and tumultuous Symphony No. 5 that he eventually was widely acclaimed by his audience and became recognised on an international level. Now begins his middle period (around 1809 onwards), a time of prolific creativity and writing of symphonies, piano concertos and chamber music. However Beethoven also discovers that he has a hearing disorder that will eventually lead to profound deafness. So follows a period of torment, self-isolation and despair until an encounter and subsequent friendship with a young blind boy awakens Beethoven’s creative spirit to lead him into the late period of his musical career, a calmer and more mature period. The film climaxes with the “piece de resistance”, Beethoven’s Symphony No. 9. Cast also includes Giulia Rubini and Ivan Desny.
